contentrichtext.text: {{BLP unsourced|date=May 2013}} {{Other people|James Kemp}} '''James W. Kemp''' is a retired United [[Methodist]] [[pastor]] and author now living in [[Lexington, Kentucky]]. In his book, ''The Gospel According to Dr. Seuss'', he says he considers Theodor S. Geisel (aka [[Dr. Seuss]]) to be his favorite [[theology|theologian]]. ==Bibliography== * Kemp, James r. ''The Gospel According to 645 South 9TH Street''. Judson Press, 2004. (ISBN 0-8170-1457-8) {{Authority control|VIAF=55995411}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Kemp, James W | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kemp, James W}} [[Category:United Methodist clergy]] [[Category:American Methodist clergy]] [[Category:American non-fiction writers]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] {{US-Christian-clergy-stub}}
